2. ì‚¬ì „ ì¤€ë¹„

1. Article: Notionâ€™s Growth

  • Notion has captured the attention of millennials and Gen Zers and its explosive growth tells us that it got it right with the market, both aesthetically and functionally.

2. Key Expressions

  • intuitive

    ì§ê´€ì ì¸

    based on what one feels to be true

  • That said

    ê·¸ë ‡ê¸´ í•˜ì§€ë§Œ

    even so


3. Questions

  • Have you used Notion before?
  • Do you prefer digital note-taking or handwriting? Explain.
  • What productivity apps do you use, and have they improved your life? Explain.

3. ë³µìŠµ

Have you used Notion before?

Yes I have. Actually, I use Notion in on a daily basis.


I think that Notion is not just a note-taking tool anymore.


First and foremost, Notion can be a team collaboration tool by using the sharing option. When I was preparing for my Kubernetes Certification with my colleagues, we used Notion a lot. w We can edit same Notion page in real-time. Thus, we can share feedback via Notion immediately.


We can edit same Notion page in real-time. Thus, we can share feedback via Notion immediately.

â†’ (Correction) Since we were able to edit the same Notion page in real-time, we were able to immediately share feedback via Notion.


Also, Y you can use Notion to build a simple static website. You donâ€™t need to know what HTML, CSS, and Javascript is are. All you need to do is just choose your template, write down what you want to say, and click â€œShare to webâ€.


Last but not least, Notion can be a database. If you choose the â€œdatabaseâ€ template, you can use Notion as database.


Last but not least, Notion can be a database. If you choose the â€œdatabaseâ€ template, you can use Notion as database.

â†’ (Correction) Last but not least, if you choose the â€œdatabaseâ€ template, you can now use Notion as a database as well.


Q. Do you prefer digital note-taking or handwriting? Explain.

I used to prefer handwriting but thanks to Notion, I prefer digital note-taking now.


What I most love love most about Notion is their â€œinsert code blockâ€ functionality. I can simply insert code block by typing a backtick three times.

a backtick three times.

â†’ (Correction) three backticks


Also, Notion supports markdown Markdown language. I built my blog with Github Pages and Gatsby. Gatsby is a static web site generator tool and I need to use Markdown language to post an article on my blog. When I use Markdown language I cannot see what the post exactly will will exactly look like. But Using Notion, I can instantly see the output of the post right away.


and I need to use Markdown to post an article on my blog.

â†’ (Correction) which requires Markdown to publish articles onto the blog.


right away

â†’ (Correction) instantly

Due to the extra functionality that Notion provides me with, Iâ€™ve come to love and prefer it for note-taking.


Q. What productivity apps do you use, and have they improved your life? Explain.

I use â€œGoodNotesâ€ to improve productivity.


â€œGoodNotesâ€ is a note-taking tool which is specialized in handwriting. Using GoodNotes with an iPad, you can draw diagrams and pictures what you used to do with physical handwriting. You can also take a note with GoodNotes and y You can even search your handwritten notes.


is specialized in handwriting

â†’ (Correction) specializes in supporting handwriting.


what you used to do with physical handwriting.

â†’ (Correction) just like you can do with physical handwriting.


You can even search your handwritten notes.

â†’ (Correction) Once youâ€™ve taken your notes, you can digitally organize them and even search through them for specific phrases.

prev.html:
1. ê¸°ë³¸ì •ë³´

  • ì¼ì •
    • 2022ë…„ 8ì›” 28ì¼ 20:00 (40ë¶„)
  • íŠœí„° ì •ë³´
    • íŠœí„° ì´ë¦„: Clare
    • íŠœí„° ëŒ€í•™ / ì „ê³µ: Stanford University / Computer Science

2. ì‚¬ì „ ì¤€ë¹„

1. Article: Career Prospect


2. Key Expressions

  • pursue a career

    ì§ì¥ì„ êµ¬í•˜ë‹¤

    to seek or find a job

  • alignment

    ì¼ì¹˜ (ë°©í–¥ì„±ì˜)

    arrangement in a straight line, a position of agreement


3. Questions

Q1. Which subjects did you enjoy the most in school? Why?

Q2. What did (or do) you study in college? Why did you choose that major?

Q3. Why do you think majors and careers donâ€™t always align?


3. ë³µìŠµ

Q1. Which subjects did you enjoy the most in school? Why?

A: I enjoyed Korean literature the most in high school and I enjoyed subjects which relates to History in college.


When I was in high school, I loved to read all kinds of books such as Korean novels, Japanese novels, essays, arts, business and so on. Because I love knowing new things and experiencing various situations indirectly through books. And literature class is the subject that I can acquire those experiences the most.


The reason why I liked subjects relates to History in college is basically the same as above. For instance, Japanese economic class made me understand unique culture of Japanese company better.


Q2. What did (or do) you study in college? Why did you choose that major?

A: I studied economics in college. I choose economics because it is popular major of the college so that I can hired by a large company more easily.


I got into Japanese university and a prominent major of the prominent university decides which company I will be able to apply. Japanese companies barely care about what we learn in class. They care about which university I graduated and what we did in extracurricular activities more. For instance, when I was looking for a job in Japan, remaining seats for the job fair shows differently for me and my friend. Even if we graduated same college, I can only apply for the large companyâ€™s job fair only because I chose the prominent major.


Q3. Why do you think majors and careers donâ€™t always align?

A: I think the reason majors and careers donâ€™t always align is that our interests keep changing while we are learning about the major and experiencing lots of new things.
